item.title: Don't Email Your Passwords and Other Adventures
item.description: Updated 24 Aug 2019: Got a response from the director of AI Industry Innovation(! thanks!). Makerspace does hash the passwords; the password was stored temporarily just for the server send it to the user in an email. They’ve agreed to remove the password confirmation via email. Suggestion: Set this up! https://securitytxt.org is a proposed IETF standard (draft-foudil-securitytxt-07 for setting up a channel for reporting security issues for your site.

item.title: Git Submodules
item.description: Here be dragons In Chuck Palahniuk’s words, "You must jump into disaster with both feet." Git submodules are generally avoided because: They tend to be poorly understood, and It’s hard to keep track one repository, let alone several that have to sync into one master project. But here we are. This is a quick overview on what Git submodules are, and how they’re useful for keeping your code manageable.
